questions.question: Which of the following types of equipment are exempt from RF exposure evaluations?

answers.text: Transceivers with less than 7 watts of RF output
Antennas that radiate only in the near field
Dish antennas less than one meter in diameter

questions.question: What is the required transmit frequency of a CW signal for channelized 60 meter operation?

answers.text: At the lowest frequency of the channel
At the center frequency of the channel
At the highest frequency of the channel
On any frequency where the signal’s sidebands are within the channel

questions.question: Which of the following constitutes a spurious emission?

answers.text: An amateur station transmission made without the proper call sign identification
A signal transmitted to prevent its detection by any station other than the intended recipient
Any transmitted signal that unintentionally interferes with another licensed radio station and whose levels exceed 40 dB below the fundamental power level
An emission outside the signal’s necessary bandwidth that can be reduced or eliminated without affecting the information transmitted

questions.question: Which of the following is required in order to operate in accordance with CEPT rules in foreign countries where permitted?

answers.text: You must identify in the official language of the country in which you are operating
The US embassy must approve of your operation
You must have a copy of FCC Public Notice DA 16-1048
You must append "/CEPT" to your call sign

questions.question: Which amateur stations are eligible to operate as Earth stations?

answers.text: Any amateur licensee who has successfully completed the AMSAT space communications course
Only those of General, Advanced or Amateur Extra class operators
Only those of Amateur Extra class operators
Any amateur station, subject to the privileges of the class of operator license held by the control operator

questions.question: To which of the following examinees may a VE not administer an examination?

answers.text: Relatives of the VE as listed in the FCC rules

questions.question: What privileges are authorized in the US to persons holding an amateur service license granted by the government of Canada?

answers.text: None, they must obtain a US license
Full privileges of the General class license on the 80-, 40-, 20-, 15-, and 10-meter bands
The operating terms and conditions of the Canadian amateur service license, not to exceed US Amateur Extra class license privileges
Full privileges, up to and including those of the Amateur Extra class license, on the 80-, 40-, 20-, 15-, and 10-meter bands

questions.question: What do the terms “L band” and “S band” specify?
What signals SSTV receiving software to begin a new picture line?
During a VHF/UHF contest, in which band segment would you expect to find the highest level of SSB or CW activity?

answers.text: At the top of each band, usually in a segment reserved for contests
In the middle of each band, usually on the national calling frequency
In the weak signal segment of the band, with most of the activity near the calling frequency
In the middle of the band, usually 25 kHz above the national calling frequency

questions.question: What type of packet frame is used to transmit APRS beacon data?
Which of the following HF digital modes uses variable-length character coding?
Atmospheric ducts capable of propagating microwave signals often form over what geographic feature?
What effect does lowering a signal’s transmitted elevation angle have on ionospheric HF skip propagation?

answers.text: The distance covered by each hop increases

questions.question: Which of the following is indicated by a sudden rise in radio background noise across a large portion of the HF spectrum?

answers.text: A coronal mass ejection impact or a solar flare has occurred
Transequatorial propagation on 6 meters is likely
Long-path propagation on the higher HF bands is likely

questions.question: Which of the following parameters does a spectrum analyzer display on the vertical and horizontal axes?
Which of the following can be used to determine the Q of a series-tuned circuit?

answers.text: The ratio of inductive reactance to capacitive reactance
The bandwidth of the circuit's frequency response
The resonant frequency of the circuit

questions.question: Which of the following choices is a good reason for selecting a high IF for a superheterodyne HF or VHF communications receiver?

answers.text: Easier for front-end circuitry to eliminate image responses

questions.question: What causes intermodulation in an electronic circuit?
What problem can occur when using an automatic notch filter (ANF) to remove interfering carriers while receiving CW signals?

answers.text: Removal of the CW signal as well as the interfering carrier
Any nearby signal passing through the DSP system will overwhelm the desired signal

questions.question: What is the resonant frequency of an RLC circuit if R is 22 ohms, L is 50 microhenries, and C is 40 picofarads?
What is the phase angle between the voltage across and the current through a series RLC circuit if XC is 300 ohms, R is 100 ohms, and XL is 100 ohms?

answers.text: 63 degrees with the voltage lagging the current
63 degrees with the voltage leading the current
27 degrees with the voltage leading the current
27 degrees with the voltage lagging the current

questions.question: Which point on Figure E5-1 best represents the impedance of a series circuit consisting of a 400-ohm resistor and a 38-picofarad capacitor at 14 MHz?
What parasitic characteristic causes electrolytic capacitors to be unsuitable for use at RF?
Which of the following indicates that a silicon NPN junction transistor is biased on?

answers.text: Base-to-emitter resistance of approximately 6 ohms to 7 ohms
Base-to-emitter resistance of approximately 0.6 ohms to 0.7 ohms
Base-to-emitter voltage of approximately 6 volts to 7 volts
Base-to-emitter voltage of approximately 0.6 volts to 0.7 volts

questions.question: Which of the following is a common use of a Schottky diode?

answers.text: In oscillator circuits as the negative resistance element
As a variable capacitance in an automatic frequency control circuit
In power supplies as a constant voltage reference
As a VHF/UHF mixer or detector

questions.question: In Figure E6-3, which is the schematic symbol for a NOR gate?
Which of the following is an aspect of the piezoelectric effect?

answers.text: Mechanical deformation of material due to the application of a voltage
Mechanical deformation of material due to the application of a magnetic field
Generation of electrical energy in the presence of light
Increased conductivity in the presence of light

questions.question: How is power supplied to the most common type of MMIC?

answers.text: Through a capacitor and RF choke connected to the amplifier input lead
Through a resistor and/or RF choke connected to the amplifier output lead
Directly to the bias voltage (Vcc) lead

questions.question: What absorbs the energy from light falling on a photovoltaic cell?
Which circuit is bistable?
In Figure E7-1, what is the purpose of R1 and R2?
Which of the following filters is used in a 2-meter band repeater duplexer?
What is the purpose of connecting equal-value resistors across power supply filter capacitors connected in series?

answers.text: Equalize the voltage across each capacitor
Discharge the capacitors when voltage is removed
Provide a minimum load on the supply

questions.question: What are the principal frequencies that appear at the output of a mixer?

answers.text: Two and four times the input frequency
The square root of the product of input frequencies
The two input frequencies along with their sum and difference frequencies

questions.question: What is the minimum number of bits required to sample a signal with a range of 1 volt at a resolution of 1 millivolt?
What voltage gain can be expected from the circuit in Figure E73 when R1 is 10 ohms and RF is 470 ohms?
What is a microphonic?

answers.text: An IC used for amplifying microphone signals
Distortion caused by RF pickup on the microphone cable
Changes in oscillator frequency caused by mechanical vibration
Excess loading of the microphone by an oscillator

questions.question: How many different input levels can be encoded by an analog-to-digital converter with 8-bit resolution?

answers.text: 8 multiplied by the gain of the input amplifier
256 divided by the gain of the input amplifier

questions.question: What is digital time division multiplexing?

answers.text: Two or more data streams are assigned to discrete sub-carriers on an FM transmitter
Two or more signals are arranged to share discrete time slots of a data transmission
Two or more data streams share the same channel by transmitting time of transmission as the sub-carrier
Two or more signals are quadrature modulated to increase bandwidth efficiency

questions.question: What technique minimizes the bandwidth of a PSK31 signal?
What parameter evaluates distortion of an AFSK signal caused by excessive input audio levels?
Which of the following factors affect the feed point impedance of an antenna?

answers.text: The settings of an antenna tuner at the transmitter

questions.question: What is the front-to-back ratio of the radiation pattern shown in Figure E92?
Which of the following describes an extended double Zepp antenna?
What is the most efficient location for a loading coil on an electrically short whip?

answers.text: Near the center of the vertical radiator
As low as possible on the vertical radiator

questions.question: What antenna matching system matches coaxial cable to an antenna by connecting the shield to the center of the antenna and the conductor a fraction of a wavelength to one side?
How does parallel conductor transmission line compare to coaxial cable with a plastic dielectric?
Which of the following is a common use for a Smith chart?

answers.text: Determine the length and position of an impedance matching stub
Determine the impedance of a transmission line, given the physical dimensions
Determine the gain of an antenna given the physical and electrical parameters
Determine the loss/100 feet of a transmission line, given the velocity factor and conductor materials

questions.question: What feature of a cardioid pattern antenna makes it useful for direction-finding antennas?
